title: Kenya: Sub-Saharan Africa Power Trade Limited - PwC
text:
PwC said ageing or badly maintained infrastructure and insufficient generation are the biggest challenges facing sub-Saharan Africa power sector. 
However, it said, stakeholders feel this situation will improve in five years' time. 
"If this proves to be the case, it is very significant. We estimate that raising the availability of generation by ten percentage points could add significantly to the continent's economy." 
According to PwC, 93 per cent of Africa's hydro-power potential is untapped. 
It said there is immense potential to develop new sources of generation in Africa mainly because costs of solar and wind generation are falling. 
"These newer renewables are also being factored into policymakers' and companies' 
decisions. There are project development step changes taking place in South Africa and Nigeria as well as exciting developments in other countries such as Kenya, Ghana and Zambia," it said. Kenya
